Eric Schmidt wrote in the Harvard Business Review that all of Google's initiatives for year are mobile-centric. We are at the point where, between the geolocation capability of the phone and the power of the phone's browser platform, it is possible to deliver personalized information about where you are, what you could do there right now, and so forth-- and to deliver such a service at scale. Eric Schmidt is, of course, referencing Google's contextual discovery capability, where the search engine without prompting sends users recommendations when it detects through a user's mobile phones that they are in close proximity to something

in the presence of her close friend Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand . Visiting Gabrielle Giffords in the hospital Wednesday, Kirsten Gillibrand stroked Gabrielle Giffords ' hand and responded with amazement as she saw her wounded colleague open her eyes. This is a major leap forward, Gabrielle Giffords ' neurosurgeon, Dr. Michael Lemole, said Thursday about the scene Kirsten Gillibrand witnessed Wednesday. "This is a major milestone for her, and we're hoping that she crosses through many more."

from his last time at the helm. "My fear would be you don't have a guy like Eric Schmidt who keeps the trains running on time," said one former Google Inc. employee. I'm having a hard time imagining Larry going from the role I've seen him in, to going to a CEO role, he added. "He can't come in and lay on the couch as he used to do and sort of interject here and there. Someone's got to lead the meetings."
